body:
## Steps to Reproduce

Whenever I restart IDE I need to enable dart support over and over. A screenshot is attached for reference.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2582649/74215027-b3617b80-4cc5-11ea-8559-b810a0b1810b.png)
 

## Version info

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2582649/74215058-cd02c300-4cc5-11ea-83e5-9544505dd3aa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2582649/74215084-e0159300-4cc5-11ea-880b-4264d8e44f0b.png)


Please help.

comment_data.body: Is this IntelliJ or Android Studio? When you restart the IDE, are you also invalidating caches?

No, I'm not invalidating caches.

On Tue, 11 Feb, 2020, 22:24 Kenzie Schmoll, <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> When you restart the IDE, are you also invalidating caches?
> [image: Screen Shot 2020-02-11 at 8 53 40 AM]
> <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43759233/74259000-0a5a5700-4cac-11ea-80a8-86944a93431e.png>
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/4371?email_source=notifications&email_token=AATWQ6L533IQERQY756RHXLRCLJ3HA5CNFSM4KS3CMAKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOELNFSEY#issuecomment-584734995>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AATWQ6INMIXJUO5GUE2I3X3RCLJ3HANCNFSM4KS3CMAA>
> .
>
@stevemessick any ideas why dart support settings wouldn't be persisting?

Gradle sync will disable Dart support. There's some discussion here: 
- https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-40082
- https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-23541

In the (currently beta) Android Studio 3.6 the Flutter plugin detects this problem and fixes it. If you can give the beta version a try we'd like to know if that fixes your problem.

Let me try that and will get back if that worked or not.

On Thu, 13 Feb, 2020, 04:23 stevemessick, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Gradle sync will disable Dart support. There's some discussion here:
>
>    - https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-40082
>    - https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-23541
>
> In the (currently beta) Android Studio 3.6 the Flutter plugin detects this
> problem and fixes it. If you can give the beta version a try we'd like to
> know if that fixes your problem.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/4371?email_source=notifications&email_token=AATWQ6IJI7M3ABY4ALJCTX3RCR4WVA5CNFSM4KS3CMAKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOELSWLYY#issuecomment-585459171>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AATWQ6JAYF7QA43MTJXH3I3RCR4WVANCNFSM4KS3CMAA>
> .
>

Really sorry I was away from work but I'm still facing the same issue on
ever restart.

On Wed, 19 Feb, 2020, 04:58 stevemessick, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @3dvirtuallabs <https://github.com/3dvirtuallabs> ping :)
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/4371?email_source=notifications&email_token=AATWQ6IDELNZSYWFEYFV2F3RDRVLLA5CNFSM4KS3CMAKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOEMFYBUA#issuecomment-587956432>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AATWQ6KQRIDGEWBVOYUKW2DRDRVLLANCNFSM4KS3CMAA>
> .
>

If you're installed any plugins other than Dart and Flutter try disabling them to see if that fixes the problem.

Is Gradle sync running in your Android Studio? Use `Help > Show Log in Finder` to locate the log files. Search in those files for `GradleSyncState`.

Of course, this may have nothing to do with Gradle. If that's the case you could try resetting the IDE metadata. Make a copy of your .idea directory, then quit Android Studio. Delete the .idea directory from your Flutter project and restart Android Studio.

Also, make sure you are using Android Studio 3.5.3 with Flutter plugin version 44.

It's not in android studio it's happening in intellij ide ultimate edition।

On Thu, 20 Feb, 2020, 02:33 stevemessick, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> If you're installed any plugins other than Dart and Flutter try disabling
> them to see if that fixes the problem.
>
> Is Gradle sync running in your Android Studio? Use Help > Show Log in
> Finder to locate the log files. Search in those files for GradleSyncState.
>
> Of course, this may have nothing to do with Gradle. If that's the case you
> could try resetting the IDE metadata. Make a copy of your .idea directory,
> then quit Android Studio. Delete the .idea directory from your Flutter
> project and restart Android Studio.
>
> Also, make sure you are using Android Studio 3.5.3 with Flutter plugin
> version 44.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/4371?email_source=notifications&email_token=AATWQ6JURGD2YJ3DY2M62STRDWNALA5CNFSM4KS3CMAKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOEMJU7TY#issuecomment-588468175>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AATWQ6M53HCA4AKTVNKU2OLRDWNALANCNFSM4KS3CMAA>
> .
>

It is odd that `flutter doctor -v` did not report IntelliJ.

My suggestions still apply. Just substitute "IntelliJ" for "Android Studio". Have you enabled the experimental setting that provides editing support like code completion and syntax highlighting for Java? (It is at the bottom of the Flutter settings page.)

Without additional information we're unfortunately not sure how to resolve this issue. We're going to close this bug for now, but please don't hesitate to comment on the bug if you have any more information for us; we're happy to reopen. Thanks for your contribution!

title: Need to enable dart support everytime
